p:
In an early study from Wuhan involving 799 patients, heart failure was one of the most commonly observed complications of COVID-19, with a reported incidence of 24% in all patients and 49% in patients who died
76 . Elevated levels of amino-terminal pro-B-type natriuretic peptide were identified in 49% of all patients (85% of those who died)
76 . Similarly, in another study of 191 patients in Wuhan, heart failure was identified in 23% of all patients and in 52% of patients who died
19 .
